title: Excel LOWER Function

metadata.description: Learn about Excel LOWER Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel LOWER Function

LOWER Function
The
LOWER
function is used to lowercase text in a cell
content_sections.content:
.
Changing the letter case of your cell values can be great when there is a lot of case inconsistency 
    among the cell inputs or when preparing your dataset for case-sensitive usage.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=LOWER
If you want to use the function on a single cell, write:
=LOWER(
cell
)
If you want to use the function on a range of cells, write:
=LOWER(
start cell
:
end cell
)
A
is uppercase.
a
is lowercase.
How to Use LOWER Function
To lower the text within an Excel cell, use
LOWER
.
Step 1)
Start the LOWER function
Select a cell
E2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=LOWER
Double click the
LOWER
command

Copy Values
Follow along the tutorial by trying it yourself!
Copy the values in the example above and try it on your own!
Step 2)
Define the cell
Select a cell (
A2
)
Hit enter
The letter case of cell
A2
has been changed!
Step 3)
Define the range to use the
LOWER
function on multiple cells
Select the starting cell (
A2
)
Add a colon (
:
)
Select the ending cell (
B21
)
Hit enter

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Excel LOWER Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Excel LOWER Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Excel LOWER Function and how to apply it in your projects.
